result.execSummary:
The defendant Bridget M. SMITH-BRANDT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Execution of sentence is stayed and the defendant is placed on probation.

miscConds.notes: For funeral expenses of the victim.  The Court will allow sixty days for the amount to be determined.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment or work search.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bridget M. SMITH-BRANDT

Order To Revoke Bail.

Defendant in custody.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 1, 1st degree reckless homicide.  Convicted.
State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2 and 3.  Motion granted.
The Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report.
PSI is due on 01-22-16.
Sentencing is set for 02-01-16 at 1:30 p.m.
The Court orders defendant to submit to a DNA sample and orders bail revoked.  State to draft the order on bail.
Minutes.
Plea date at 11-19-2015 08:30 am

Scheduling/Plea Date for 08-07-2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Whereas the above matter came before the court on May 12, 2015, for defendant's motion to modify bond, after listening to arguments of counsel, the Court now orders:
1.  That the bond in this matter be lowered to $7,500.00 cash. 
2.  That the defendant report daily by 5:00 p.m. to the Manitowoc County Jail.
3. That the defendant live in Manitowoc County.
4.  That the defendant not leave Manitowoc County.
5.  That the defendant have no contact with members of the Brandt family.
6.  That the defendant maintain absolute sobriety.
7.  That any other conditions of bond previously set and not modified by this order remain in place. 
Cover Letter.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 07-14-15 at 2:30 p.m.
Plea date set for 07-14-15 at 2:30 p.m.

Defendant in custody.   
Counsel argue motion to modify bail.  Court reduces defendant's bond to $7,500.00 cash with the conditions that: Defendant must report daily to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department no later than 5:00 p.m.; Defendant must reside in Manitowoc County and not leave Manitowoc County; Defendant is to have no contact with the Brandt family and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.   
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail Issued.  Copy filed.
